intro: Cerastium lamyi, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early summer, and its leaves are typically rounded and hairy. Cerastium lamyi thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in mountainous environments. It is well adapted to cold climates and can withstand harsh alpine conditions.
